Posts.Content: Nov 19, 2008 01:54PM wildangel5 wrote: Thank you so much for the welcome.  Your advice is perfect - now I just have to get it in my head!  I'm telling myself I'm lucky that at least I didn't have to wait weeks to get the ultrasound and the biopsy as I've read some do.  My mother would always tell us to keep busy so I'm going to try (and try and try). I'm a great believer and user of message boards.  But in the past they've almost always been regarding my dogs and their health.  Although I've made great friends on those boards and they are awaiting my results as well. Maybe one good thing that will come out of this will be my bf wanting to end the LD thing and realizing how much I mean to him!  Ha! Thank you again.  Is there any way on here to know where everyone is at?  To know if anyone is close to where I'm located (near Buffalo)?
Posts.Title: Wire Biopsy Done...Now Waiting for Results shap wildangel5

Posts.Content: Nov 19, 2008 12:01PM wildangel5 wrote: Hi!  My name is Janice.  I just found this place today.  I had my regular mammogram on Monday and the doctor saw "something" on 2 views but not on the other 2.  I had an ultrasound right away but neither the doctor nor the tech could find the area.  I went back for the biopsy today and like you I'm waiting for results.  The procedure itself wasn't bad and I'm not really sore.  But I'm a nervous wreck.  Seems strange to me since I was always warned to watch out for lumps and I have nothing that can be felt. I live alone and my bf and I are in a ld relationship.  Closest family (sister) is 400 miles away so I just needed to know I'm not "really" alone!
Posts.Title: Wire Biopsy Done...Now Waiting for Results shap wildangel5
